column1: Just to clarify you chose health and what did you think about the use of VR in the story what parts of this story stood out to you
child 10:03

part of it was that when he was doing his exercise to help him learn to walk instead he played video games. Sure they did help him with getting through the pain but still he shouldn't just be playing video games
Researcher  10:30
interesting was there anything from the home one that stood out to you
child  10:42
it was a good thing, it's that family still got to spend time with each other even though they couldn't see each other in person
Researcher  10:56
What problems do you think VR might create for you as a kid
child  11:01
I might  get too addicted to start doing it when I'm not supposed to
Researcher  11:09
what do you think should decide which VR experiences are a good choice for children?
child  11:14
My mom or my dad...a little bit my brother. equals distribution between my mom and dad. Like a lot less for my brother because he isn't always the most responsive.

When VR makers create VR experiences for children's and families, what are some of the more important things that they should keep in mind?

they shouldn't be violent. Really, that's all I can think of
